page.title: 10LOCAL HISTORY. LANDSCAPE
page.content: GT. HARWOOD IS A SMALL TOWN IN THE MIDDLE OF LANCASHIRE SURROUNED BY SOME BEAUTIFUL COUNTRYSIDE.IT LIES NEAR PENDLE HILL.ITS PROSPERITY WAS BASED ON THE COTTON TRADE BUT ONLY ONE COTTON MILL STILL WORKS.THE RAILWAY LINE WAS CLOSED AND THE RAILWAY LINES HAVE GONE AND THE CUTTINGS FILLED IN.THERE ARE SEVERAL BUILDING AND MONUMENTS REMINDING US OF THE PAST.THE TOWN HALL CLOCK A MEMORIAL TO JOHN MERCER AN INVENTOR OF A FAMOUS COTTON PROCESS. CHURCHFIELD HOUSE BUILT FOR HENRY AINSWORTH A SURGEON IN 1851.MERCER HALL BUILT AS A COMMUNITY HALL, FINISHED IN 1916.WAR MEMORIAL AND PARK IN MEMORY OF MEN KILLED IN THE 1914/18 WAR OTHER NAMES WERE ADDED IN 1945.THE PARISH CHURCH 16TH C. ALLSPRINGS BUILT BY JAMES LOMAX IN 1838.ROGER NOWELL BUILT READ HALL IN 1750
